page.title: 11FARMING EGMANTON/LAXTON
page.content: Most of the land in this area is used for farming, with a predominance of cereal crops. Other crops grown are oilseed rape, sugar beet, potatoes and silage. A typical crop rotation works ovee five years and is:_ 1st year, oilseed rape, 2nd and 3rd years, wheat, 4th and 5th years, barley or barley and potatoes. Excluding Laxton, there are 12 working farms in the area, plus 3 smaller specialized farms; each one is worked by the owners and the average size is about 200 acres. Unlike much of the surrounding land, none has yet been taken over by large concerns and the field boundaries remain very much unchanged. Of the 12 farms, only two now keep dairy cattle, the remainder being fatstock and arable, two specialising in pigs and one in calf rearing.
